title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 24 August 2016 - XWiki
content:
<jonesmeier> has quit  
03:23 <jonesmeier> has joined #xwiki  
04:11 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
05:09 <edvorg> has quit  
05:16 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
05:28 <edvorg> has quit  
05:37 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
05:46 <edvorg> has joined #xwiki  
05:46 <edvorg> has quit  
07:02 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
07:06 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
07:40 <msmeria> has quit  
07:43 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:39 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:47 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <mflorea> has quit  
09:34 <vmassol> good morning everyone  
09:38 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <vmassol> @all: we just got a new feedback form result. I've put it at http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/DownloadFormFeedback  
09:58 <vmassol> mflorea: after 5 refresh on the home page I got the problem again  
09:58 <vmassol> interestingly I got the 2 errors  
09:58 <vmassol> 1) GET http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/tree.js  
09:58 <vmassol> and  
09:58 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <vmassol> 2) Uncaught Error: Script error for "tree"  
09:59 <vmassol> ah no  
09:59 <vmassol> it's only tree-related  
09:59 <vmassol> no export.js issue ineed  
09:59 <vmassol> \*indeed  
09:59 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <vmassol> I'm getting it very frequently atually  
09:59 <vmassol> one out of 2-3 times  
10:00 <mflorea> ok  
10:00 <mflorea> only on Chrome, right?  
10:00 <vmassol> checking FF now  
10:01 <vmassol> ah wait  
10:01 <vmassol> there's worse  
10:01 <vmassol> the tour doesn't start on chrome  
10:01 <vmassol> but it does on FF  
10:03 <teekeino> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <teekeino> What does prefix xwiki: in document names mean?  
10:04 <vmassol> correctionl it works  
10:04 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <vmassol> I didn't know that we were saving the fact that the tour has been executed in the local storage of the browser  
10:04 <vmassol> (thought it was in the perm dir)  
10:05 <vmassol> teekeino: that's to indicate the name fo the wiki to target  
10:05 <vmassol> teekeino: see http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/XWikiSyntax?syntax=2.1&section=Links  
10:06 <vmassol> check "Absolute link to pagePageB located in PageA in wiki WikiA"  
10:06 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:07 <teekeino> vmassol: so if that prefix is used and the said document is elsewhere - say in subwiki - the query will die in flames?  
10:07 <vmassol> it'll just say it doesn't exist  
10:07 <vmassol> (not sure what query you're referring toà  
10:07 <vmassol> )  
10:09 <teekeino> vmassol: I'm beating the Google Apps extension into submission, so far I have removed said prefix from calls such as xwiki.parseGroovyFromPage("xwiki:GoogleApps.CookieAuthenticationPersistenceStoreTools")  
10:09 <vmassol> that's probably valid  
10:09 <vmassol> I guess this app should be installed in the main wiki  
10:09 <teekeino> vmassol: I installed the extension into a subwiki :-P  
10:09 <vmassol> which is why it's not working  
10:09 <vmassol> it's probably not meant to  
10:10 <vmassol> but I don't knpw  
10:10 <vmassol> \*know  
10:10 <vmassol> I've never used it  
10:10 <teekeino> Hooray. That would make sense, there was no safeguard in extension like in some extensions to prevent it from being installed elsewhere  
10:10 <vmassol> there is  
10:11 <vmassol> :)  
10:11 <vmassol> it's just that this extension creator has not used it  
10:11 <vmassol> a pity....  
10:11 <teekeino> Ok, I'll update tickets I opened on this  
10:11 <vmassol> teekeino: see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XWiki+Commons+-+Extension+-+Repository+-+Maven#HCustomproperties  
10:12 <vmassol> the property is named xwiki.extension.namespaces  
10:12 <vmassol> you could opena jira issue for this  
10:12 <vmassol> (so that this extension uses it)  
10:13 <teekeino> I will, thanks  
10:32 <vmassol> tmortagne: is http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/BuildingInEclipse still ok? I see there's a broken link to XEclipse too. Do you think you could reivew it when you get some time?  
10:32 <vmassol> there's also http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/XWikiAndEclipse\_Setup  
10:32 <vmassol> would be nice to have only one since it's confusig otherwise  
10:32 <tmortagne> vmassol: I don't know anything about http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/BuildingInEclipse  
10:33 <vmassol> that was what was there befre you added the second one I guess  
10:33 <tmortagne> no  
10:33 <tmortagne> what I use is http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DebugXEWithEclipse  
10:33 <vmassol> ah another one :)  
10:33 <Enygma`> has quit  
10:33 <vmassol> so we have 3  
10:33 <vmassol> nice…. :(  
10:33 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:33 <tmortagne> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/XWikiAndEclipse\_Setup is talking about subclipse...  
10:34 <vmassol> tmortagne: what I know is that http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Building#HBuildinginEclipse  
10:34 <vmassol> the building page directs to http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/BuildingInEclipse  
10:34 <vmassol> so that's the one user will see mostl likely  
10:35 <vmassol> would be nice to put some order in all this  
10:35 <vmassol> and have a single page  
10:35 <tmortagne> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/BuildingInEclipse and http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/DebugXEWithEclipse are two different things  
10:35 <tmortagne> and the first one link to the second  
10:35 <tmortagne> but http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/XWikiAndEclipse\_Setup seems very old and probably wrong  
10:36 <vmassol> but http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/BuildingInEclipse seems old too  
10:36 <tmortagne> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/BuildingInEclipse looks ok as en entry point which it seems to be right now  
10:37 <tmortagne> not as old as the other one which tell you to use subversion...  
10:38 <tmortagne> what is on dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/BuildingInEclipse (not much actually) seems accurate  
10:38 <tmortagne> except for the broken link to XEclipse of course  
10:38 <tmortagne> but XEclipse should probably simply be removed from that list  
10:38 <vmassol> I was wondering about that  
10:38 <vmassol> I initially removed it  
10:38 <vmassol> and then instead fixed the link  
10:39 <vmassol> I'll just add a comment that it's not been supported for a long time  
10:39 <vmassol> but I'd love for someoe to find it and decide to contribute to it:)  
10:40 <vmassol> done  
10:40 <vmassol> it probably still works  
10:40 <tmortagne> I doubt this will happen and on our side it's better to invest in XWebIDE  
10:41 <vmassol> a pity because I personally prefer xeclipse a lot more for developing  
10:41 <vmassol> (I don't like standalone apps as web browser tabs)  
10:41 <vmassol> I'll add a link to xwebide from xeclipse  
10:41 <vmassol> (good idea)  
10:42 <vmassol> doc for http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XWebIDE+Application is missing a nice welcome image  
10:44 <tmortagne> yes, should start with a general screenshot of the application  
10:44 <tmortagne> probably like the one in http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XWebIDE+Application#HEditor  
10:51 <vmassol> yep  
10:53 <tmortagne> but not resized by XWiki :)  
10:53 <tmortagne> (we really need to fix this)  
11:01 <gdelhumeau> ANN: HOLD YOUR COMMITS ON MASTER PLEASE  
11:37 <teekeino> Help, I need to close some Jira tickets I opened but can't. For example GOOGAPPS-24  
11:38 <vmassol> teekeino: I can close it for you if you want  
11:39 <teekeino> vmassol: yes thanks. I'll probably ask you to close few more soon :-)  
11:43 <vmassol> ok np on the phone ATM  
11:49 <Enygma`> has quit  
12:00 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
12:36 <acotiuga> has quit  
13:00 <tmortagne> has quit  
13:05 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
13:07 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
13:18 <DarkKnightCZ> Hi, can any dev look at XWIKI-10118 and comment it if needed? Thanks  
13:51 <vmassol> DarkKnightCZ: I wanted to look at it yesterday but I'm busy with the release of 8.3M1 and a few other things. I'll try to do it later this week if nobody beats me to it  
13:51 <vmassol> if someone else is interested to check it out, please go ahead!  
13:54 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: your last commit will not break anything in platform?  
13:54 <gdelhumeau> I'm going to start the maven part of the release  
14:00 <DarkKnightCZ> vmassol: thanks  
14:02 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: wait  
14:02 <vmassol> there's marius committing a fix for the explorer.js  
14:03 <teekeino> has quit  
14:17 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: it's fixing a bug  
14:18 <gdelhumeau> in platform?  
14:18 <tmortagne> it's fixing a bug in commons so yes it impact platform  
14:19 <tmortagne> it's not a new jira issue, there is already commits for it  
14:23 <tmortagne> has quit  
14:24 <gdelhumeau> thx mflorea  
14:25 <mflorea> yw  
14:36 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:13 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:14 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:37 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:52 <acotiuga> has quit  
15:57 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:59 <msmeria> has quit  
16:38 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: actually I should have asked you if this commit is dangerous or not  
16:38 <gdelhumeau> so I can release or not without waiting the build  
16:39 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: and my answer was that it fixes something that was already committed so what was dangerous was not not commit it  
16:40 <gdelhumeau> but is your fix the final answer?  
16:40 <tmortagne> yes  
16:40 <gdelhumeau> so we wan rely on it?  
16:40 <tmortagne> I don't have anything else to commit  
16:40 <gdelhumeau> \*can  
16:41 <tmortagne> it fixed what it was supposed to fix according to jenkins  
16:41 <vmassol> tmortagne: the build was fully passsing this morning before your commit  
16:41 <vmassol> does it mean we were missing some tests for the bug you fix in that last commit?  
16:41 <tmortagne> vmassol: not in 7.4 it was not  
16:41 <vmassol> ah yes but we're releasing master  
16:41 <vmassol> not 7.4  
16:42 <tmortagne> and the regression was not visible in master  
16:42 <vmassol> so GD is asking for master  
16:42 <tmortagne> but it was there  
16:42 <vmassol> ok so missing some tests in master I assume  
16:42 <tmortagne> it's just that master is using a different method in its tests  
16:44 <gdelhumeau> so I'll wait for platform but  not for xe  
16:59 <gdelhumeau> [ANN] Releasing  
17:05 <vmassol> yeah!  
17:11 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:26 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
17:44 <gdelhumeau> getting the translations is very vey slow  
17:45 <vmassol> I had noticed that since the upgrade of xwiki, l10n was very slow  
17:46 <vmassol> I pinged thomas about it. Thomas has tried to do something to the DB but it didn't help. So I guess right now we don't know what's the problem but indeed if that makes the release slower than it should it's a pain and we should look into it even more  
17:46 <gdelhumeau> or getting translations before doing the release  
17:46 <gdelhumeau> during the days before  
17:47 <vmassol> that's a workaround, we need to fix the root issue  
17:48 <mflorea> has quit  
18:37 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:43 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
18:53 <evalica> has quit  
19:00 <Enygma`> has quit  
20:23 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
21:17 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
21:27 <vmassol> has quit  
21:54 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
22:44 <mflorea> has quit  
23:46 <gdelhumeau> has quit
